reviewText: I'd heard of this movie over the years.  Never got a chance to see it before, but always wanted to.  I was quite pleased.  The actors did very well with their dialog, the writing was to the point.  Nothing in this movie was wasted.  I must say, though, the cover of this dvd has always confused me.  The title characters are the ones in the BACKGROUND...not the two actors in the front!

reviewText: I like this movie! Especially Irene Cara! I Love her! She is the best! Good actress as well as a singer! This was her first movie before sparkle. I like the movie, the ending was ok, but could have done better! This is a perfect gift for a friend of mine! She is going to love this! This is a hard to find movie! You could never get this in stores! You got to get this one here at amazon! Thanks amazon once again!De'Vear Smalls (AKA Dee Smalls)Representing Decatur GA)
summary: This movie is on point! Another one from back in the day!

reviewerName: Eddie Landsberg "My 10th year as a reviewer !...
reviewText: At the time of this writing AARON LOVES ANGELA is out-of-print...  This is awful, because there are so many incredible reasons to watch this film... besides the appearence of a very young Irene Cara (who I always found to be a hottie), and a cameo club appearence and performance of Jose Feleciano (somewhat reminiscent of Curtis Mayfield's appearence in SUPERFLY) - - and this was the era when Feleciano was so funky he was even rocking Soul Train.As for the story - - its an adaptation of Romeo and Juliet that takes places in NYC - - a love tale between a young black teenageer and a Puerto Rican girl who are caught in between the intolerance of the world around them.The look of the film has that gritty yet colorful '70s blaxploitation vibe - - yet the story is touching, exciting and engaging...  All in all, the inavailability of both this and 180 Blocks from Tiffany's is discraceful ! ! !
summary: Gritty '70s Urban Drama at its Best !
